name: SEER Primary Tumor
title: SEER Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:**  Neuroendocrine tumors (NET) stated to be in situ, noninvasive, or confined to mucosa are classified as in situ (code 000). "Dysplasia" alone is generally not reportable in cancer registries but, if a registry does collect it, code 000 should be used. 

**Note 2:**  Intraluminal or intramural extension to esophagus and duodenum is classified by the depth of greatest invasion. For extension to esophagus or duodenum via serosa, code as regional (code 200).
footnotes:
\#  Considered localized in Historic Stage
\## Considered regional in Historic Stage 
\** Considered regional in 1977 Summary Staging Guide
